items.text: slower ball again, and full toss dipping outside off. throws his bat at it and gets it away past cover point
items.shortText: Gulbadin Naib to Mahmudullah, 1 run

items.text: yorker, dug out to the offside
items.shortText: Gulbadin Naib to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: attempted slower yorker, he gives himself room and drives it powerfully to long-off
items.shortText: Gulbadin Naib to Mahmudullah, 1 run

items.text: another slower ball that ends up a full toss outside off, and he gets enough bat on it to slash it away to the point boundary
items.shortText: Gulbadin Naib to Imrul Kayes, FOUR runs

items.text: gets the yorker right this time, squeezed out to the bowler
items.shortText: Gulbadin Naib to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.preText: Nayeem: "Heroic knock from Kayes who just flew from Dhaka about 12 hours ago and playing a match. Hats off Sir."
items.text: yorker, goes through him. outside off stump and sneaks under the bat, but past the stumps
items.shortText: Aftab Alam to Mahmudullah, no run

items.text: bad ball gets a wicket too short and too wide outside off. If he had left it alone it would have been a wide probably, but at this stage you back yourself to find the boundary if set and he reached out to carve it. Went straight to Rashid on the point fence though
items.shortText: Aftab Alam to Mahmudullah, OUT

dismissal.text: Mahmudullah c Rashid Khan b Aftab Alam 74 (81b 3x4 2x6) SR: 91.35

items.preText:
Can Mortaza whack a few in the death overs?

Tasmeem: "I've always thought Imrul has what it takes to succeed in the International arena. Don't know why he keeps failing, but this innings again proves his obvious talent. "
items.text: slower bouncer outside off, he just watched it go. He thought it might be a wide and looks at the umpire, but that was within the white lines
items.shortText: Aftab Alam to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: tries for the yorker again, but strays down leg and is whipped away to square leg
items.shortText: Aftab Alam to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: yorker on the stumps, tapped to midwicket
items.shortText: Aftab Alam to Mashrafe Mortaza, 1 run

items.text: great timing stays back and pulls this short of a ball past square leg
items.shortText: Aftab Alam to Imrul Kayes, FOUR runs

items.preText: Tazz: "Agree with Tasmeem. If Imrul's performance is compared with Liton's, Shoumya's or even with Sabbir's performance for last 3/4 years, I don't find any reason to drop him off now and then. If Imrul fails for 2 matches straight, the next match he is off the team, which didn't happen for those players mentioned. I think its unfair to Imrul. "
items.text: googly, he wanted an almighty swipe at it. gets enough bat on it to send it to deep square leg
items.shortText: Rashid Khan to Mashrafe Mortaza, 1 run

items.text: reverse sweep read that perfectly and timed his reverse sweep superbly to get it past the third man fielder
items.shortText: Rashid Khan to Imrul Kayes, FOUR runs

items.text: nudged to fine leg
items.shortText: Rashid Khan to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: steps away to thwack it but only gets it to cover
items.shortText: Rashid Khan to Mashrafe Mortaza, no run

items.text: another big heave and he gets an inside edge that rolls past the wicketkeeper. They steal a single and there is a needless shy at the stumps by Mujeeb running in from short fine leg, allowing an overthrow
items.shortText: Rashid Khan to Mashrafe Mortaza, 2 runs

items.text: pulled away powerfully. Short ball that sat up and Mashrafe got hold of it, but the man at deep midwicket stops it
items.shortText: Rashid Khan to Mashrafe Mortaza, 1 run

items.preText: Atiq: "No disrespect to anyone commenting, but a specialist batsman such as Kayes is expected to play responsibly. I feel we tend to overdo with both praising and admonishing the players. Too often we judge our players either as a hero or a zero, but seldom as an average Joe."
items.text: inside edge four He wanted to send that over long-on, but gets an inside edge that races to the fine leg fence
items.shortText: Aftab Alam to Mashrafe Mortaza, FOUR runs

items.text: gets the yorker right and he can only dig it back out to the bowler. Aftab has a mock shy at the stumps
items.shortText: Aftab Alam to Mashrafe Mortaza, no run

items.text: full ball on the pads. Mashrafe was moving around in his crease but Aftab bowled it well. Driven to long-on
items.shortText: Aftab Alam to Mashrafe Mortaza, 1 run

items.text: full on off, he steps away and lofts it over the circle, but there is long-off who collects it one bounce
items.shortText: Aftab Alam to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: clever bowling Mashrafe was moving across to paddle it perhaps. Aftab spotted it, and bowled another of his slower ones. The batsman didn't pick it, and the ball kissed his bat to lob up to the keeper for the simplest of catches
items.shortText: Aftab Alam to Mashrafe Mortaza, OUT

dismissal.text: Mashrafe Mortaza c †Mohammad Shahzad b Aftab Alam 10 (9b 1x4 0x6) SR: 111.11

items.text: comes down the track and swings at it, the thick edge rolls down to third man
items.shortText: Aftab Alam to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 2 runs

items.preText:
Rakhesh: "I raised this question last time also, though my comment was not published, why is Asghar Stanikzai referred as Asghar Afghan these days?" - He's officially changed his name.

Mayank: "Feels like we are back in 90s. 240-250 are winning totals here and 220 odd is defendable." - I for one find it refreshing
items.text: picked up the slower ball full toss outside off and swatted it to long-on
items.postText: Darshan Mandali: "I feel today both matches will go down to last over. This match as well as Ind vs Pak match. Super duper sunday and need of very high speed internet to see one match on TV and another on laptop. "
items.shortText: Gulbadin Naib to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: moved across his stumps a long way and the bowler followed him, but he was able to pick it up off his feet and hit it to deep square leg
items.shortText: Gulbadin Naib to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 2 runs
